intro: Leptoderris glabrata var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-leaved leptoderris, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical studies and ecological research.
